captions.text: Early in the Panda House
Yuan Zai is about to wake up
The side door is open. Yuan Yuan casually walks there to eat breakfast.
Yuan Zai, wake up!
Stop being so lazy!
It's time to check your weight!
The zookeeper will check Yuan Zai's weight then blood oxygen content
At the beginning, Yuan Zai was behaving
But shortly after....
Yuan Zai began to struggle
She kept wiggling her butt
Looking east
Looking west
Yuan Zai's steps are becoming steadier
The zookeeper is letting her learn to walk in the delivery room
Yuan Zai crawls out of the planks within a few steps
then goes explore
Yuan Zai is starting to be wary, listening to the zookeeper
moving bamboo or cleaning the floor
So she walks forward with determination
Yuan Zai, although not very balanced yet, tries hard
to find out where the sound is coming from
If there's too much sound surrounding her, she might go the wrong way
Now, Yuan Zai will not only move with the sounds
but is also interested in moving objects
The zookeeper has to be very careful of Yuan Zai's location
because she won't behave and wait in the delivery room
She crawls out, following the zookeeper or the broom
like a subordinate
The mom, Yuan Yuan, is also watching from the side
Don't go!
When Yuan Zai is tired, she will sit and rest a little
She sometimes interferes with the zookeeper's duties
So they carry Yuan Zai back to the nursing room
But she still wants to go explore
Yuan Zai learning how to walk is very entertaining!

title: 圓仔小跟班 Baby Giant Panda Followed The Zookeeper

comments.text: +Emily Chen Lol yall silly.
comments.author: Josh Persaud

comments.text:
Okay I JUST SAID I was sorry for my ignorance I'm not proclaiming anything 
I was only speaking what I thought was the correct information. I removed 
my ignorant comments and apologized. That should be the end of the matter. 
You act like a U.S. citizen that was ignorant on a matter, saying that 
Taiwan isn't a part of China (which at the time I thought it was not) is 
going to start a war between China and Taiwan. This is the YouTube COMMENT 
section it's not going to do you Taiwanese any harm. So bye felicia!
comments.author: Emily Chen

comments.text:
LOL my mistake. I took the comments down. I'm from the U.S. and I'm half 
Hispanic which I actually affiliate myself more with that culture since my 
mother raised me. I only have knowledge of Taiwan from my dad's side of my 
family so I was only speaking off of what they told me. But after some 
research I found that you are correct. So I offer my apologies if I 
offended you. I was raised and told something different by my family that 
is from Taiwan. But then again, I'm a Texan so I got a lot of schooling 
about Mexican and Texan history! Lol
comments.author: Emily Chen
